intro: Anagallis linifolia var. schousboei, commonly known as the Schousboe's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often found in Mediterranean regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
